result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephanie L. VICE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • PTC Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Provide DNA sample.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, commencing immediately.

Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The matter is continued for a Plea Hearing on 06-30-2016 at 3:00 p.m., Br. 1.  Bail is set at an additional $500.00 cash, total $1,000.00 cash, with the continuing condition that she rmaintain absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol. Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the county jail.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail Issued.  Copy filed.
Warrant returned with service of officer thereon.

Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture.
Copies to defendant, DA, Attorney Hoff and Philip Schmidt.

Defendant failed to appear for a plea date.  She is a walk away from the Manitowoc County Jail at this time.
State requests warrant and forfeiture of bail.
Court authorizes warrant and forfeiture of bail.

Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Amending the count 3 violation date to 09-30-2015 and amending the probable cause portion.

The Court is concerned the defendant is under the influence. Preliminary Hearing reset to 10-21-2015 at 3:00 p.m., Br. 1.
The Court amends the defendant's Bail Bond, adding condition if the Court determines the defendant is under the influence or the Court believes she is under the influence, the Court will make her subject to random urine screen to determine if she is using narcotics or alcohol.

Philip Hoff, through Public Defender.

$500.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.   
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 10-14-15 at 2:00 p.m.   
Minutes.
At 9:41 a.m., search warrant with return of officer thereon.  (ORDERED SEALED BY THE COURT)

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2 counts PTC deliver heroin and deliver heroin.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 10-05-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the conditions that she report to the Two Rivers City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and maintain absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.   Bail not  furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
Request for Warrant; Warrant; Affidavit of officer in Support of Warrant; Findings and Order Re: Warrant.   (ORDERED SEALED BY THE COURT)
